SEARCH
Package Domain

Class Loan

java.lang.Object
Domain.Loan
public class Loan extends Object
Represents a loan transaction in the library system. A Loan tracks which user borrowed which media item, as well as borrowing date, due date, and return date.

Example usage:


 Loan loan = new Loan("L001", user, mediaItem, LocalDate.now());
 boolean overdue = loan.isOverdue(LocalDate.now());
 int fine = loan.calculateFine(LocalDate.now());
Since:
1.0

  • Constructor Details

    • Loan

      public Loan(String loanId, User user, MediaItem mediaItem, LocalDate borrowDate)
      Creates a new loan record for a user and a media item. The due date is automatically calculated based on the item's borrowing period.
      Parameters:
      loanId - unique identifier of the loan
      user - the user who borrowed the item
      mediaItem - the media item being borrowed
      borrowDate - the date the loan begins

  • Method Details

    • isOverdue

      public boolean isOverdue(LocalDate currentDate)
      Checks if this loan is overdue based on the given current date.
      Parameters:
      currentDate - the date used to evaluate overdue status
      Returns:
      true if the item is not returned and currentDate is after the due date

    • getOverdueDays

      public int getOverdueDays(LocalDate currentDate)
      Calculates the number of days the loan is overdue.
      Parameters:
      currentDate - the date used for the calculation
      Returns:
      the number of overdue days, or 0 if not overdue

    • calculateFine

      public int calculateFine(LocalDate currentDate)
      Calculates the fine owed for this loan based on overdue days.
      Parameters:
      currentDate - the date used to calculate the fine
      Returns:
      the total fine amount

    • returnItem

      public void returnItem(LocalDate returnDate)
      Marks the media item as returned and updates the return date.
      Parameters:
      returnDate - the date the item was returned

    • getLoanId

      public String getLoanId()
      Returns:
      the loan ID

    • getUser

      public User getUser()
      Returns:
      the user who borrowed the item

      Returns:

    • getReturnDate

      public LocalDate getReturnDate()
      Returns:
      the return date, or null if not returned yet
